alert.note: Alert for Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 09 at 9:18PM CDT until August 09 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Coosa County in east central Alabama... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 918 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Talladega Springs, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Goodwater, Rockford, Kellyton, Weogufka, Equality, Stewartville, Hanover, Bradford, Cottage Grove, Strickland Crossroads, Bentleyville, Highway 9 and Highway 22, Unity, Marble Valley, Moriah, Hatchet, Nixburg, Crewsville, Lay Lake and Western Lake Martin. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
